name: 1913 Copper Miners strike, Michigan
description: A commemorative site and blog established to coordinate activities relating to the centennial of the 1913-14 Michigan Copper Minersâ€™ Strike.

name: AFSCME Roll of Honor
description: A marker placed to honor men and women who put their lives on the line, emphasizing the need for safety measures and OSHA coverage for public employees.
address: 444 E Main St, New Britain, CT 06051, USA

name: American Factory Worker Sculptures
description: Six statues originally exhibited at the 1933 Chicago Century of Progress Exposition, discovered in storage rooms of the Museum of Science & Industry.
address: 5700 S DuSable Lake Shore Dr, Chicago, IL 60637, USA

name: A. Phillip Randolph Pullman Porter Museum
description: A museum dedicated to the history of A. Phillip Randolph and the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters.
address: 10406 S Maryland Ave, Chicago, IL 60628, USA

name: Alabama Labor History Association
description: An organization currently in formation dedicated to preserving and promoting the labor history of Alabama.

name: American Federation of Labor Founding Marker
description: A state historical marker commemorating the founding of the American Federation of Labor in Pittsburgh.

name: AFL-CIO Headquarters
description: The national headquarters of the AFL-CIO, which serves as a central hub for labor advocacy and also houses various memorials.

name: Allegheny Arsenal Explosion Monument
description: A monument dedicated to the victims of the catastrophic 1862 explosion at the Allegheny Arsenal during the Civil War.

name: American Federation of Labor Headquarters
description: Site of the historic headquarters of the AFL, marked with a plaque to denote its significance in organized labor history.
address: 901 Massachusetts Ave NW, Washington, DC 20001, USA

name: American Federation of Teachers First Office
description: The location of the very first office used by the American Federation of Teachers during its founding years.

name: American Merchant Marine Veterans Memorial
description: A large sculpture and monument honoring the service and sacrifice of American Merchant Marine veterans.

name: Anderson, Colonel James, Monument
description: A monument dedicated to Colonel James Anderson, known for his support of early libraries for working men.

name: American Labor Museum (Botto House)
description: The Pietro and Maria Botto House served as a meeting place during the 1913 Paterson Silk Strike and is now a museum of labor history.

name: American Merchant Seamen Memorial
description: A memorial dedicated to the contributions and memory of merchant seamen on the riverfront.

name: Anthracite Boys Bust
description: A statue commemorating the 'breaker boys' and children who worked in the anthracite coal mines of Pennsylvania.
